snippet: The Central African Republic has descended into chaos since rebels ousted President François Bozizé in March, the latest coup in a country that remains one of the world’s poorest.
abstract: France pledges to boost its troop presence in Central African Republic by end of 2013 to help prevent it from spiraling out of control; country has descended into chaos since rebels ousted Pres Francois Bozize in March, latest coup in one of world's poorest nations.
lead_paragraph: The Central African Republic has descended into chaos since rebels ousted President François Bozizé in March, the latest coup in a country that remains one of the world’s poorest.

headline.main: France to Send More Troops Into Africa
headline.print_headline: France to Send More Troops Into Africa
